intro: Isonandra betis, commonly known as the Betis isonandra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
